protocol_name: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
protocol_name_html: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
description: This is a protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase from the Doudna Lab.

groups.group_name: The Center for Genome Editing and Recording

guidelines:
Template design:


T7 polymerase requires a double-stranded promoter region for efficient template binding, but can then transcribe a single-stranded DNA template. Therefore, the following protocol uses an approach, whereby two oligos are annealed in order to generate a dsDNA promoter, followed by a single-stranded overhang that contains the reverse complement of the desired RNA sequence.

  • The reverse complement of the desired RNA sequence is ordered as a DNA oligo (assuming the length does not exceed ~80 nt), to which the reverse complement of the T7 promoter is appended at the 3’ end
    • Example template: 

                      

  • A separate, synthetic DNA oligo is ordered that contains the T7 promoter in the forward direction, which can be annealed with the above construct:
    • T7oligo: 5’-TAATACGACTCACTATA-3’
    • Note: according to Ambion, for transcription of synthetic oligonucleotides, only the -17 to -1 positions of the promoter need to be double-stranded. This oligo takes this into account.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Mix the following in a final volume of 100 µl: 

  • 20 µl 5x transcription buffer 
  • 1.5 nmol T7oligo (15 uM final) 
  • 1.0 nmol template (10 uM final) 
  • DEPC H2O to 100 µl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Mix the following in a final volume of 100 µl: 

  • 20 µl 5x transcription buffer 
  • 1.5 nmol T7oligo (15 uM final) 
  • 1.0 nmol template (10 uM final) 
  • DEPC H2O to 100 µl
Heat at 70-80 °C for 2 minutes.
Slow cool on bench-top.
Use immediately or store at -20 °C.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 4 of Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.protocol_name: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.annotation: For some applications, prior gel purification of the DNA template may be desirable. However, for my transcriptions, the oligos are not very long and I immediately gel purify the RNAs after transcription, so purity of the DNA oligo is not a major concern.
source_data.thread_text: For some applications, prior gel purification of the DNA template may be desirable. However, for my transcriptions, the oligos are not very long and I immediately gel purify the RNAs after transcription, so purity of the DNA oligo is not a major concern.
source_data.body: For some applications, prior gel purification of the DNA template may be desirable. However, for my transcriptions, the oligos are not very long and I immediately gel purify the RNAs after transcription, so purity of the DNA oligo is not a major concern.

components.data: Add 500 μl of RNase-free H2O to the 70-80 mg of each NTP.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 μl of RNase-free H2O to the 70-80 mg of each NTP.

components.data: Bring pH of each NTP to 6.8-7.2 by adding 5 µl of 5N NaOH followed by 10-90 µl of 1N NaOH. Monitor pH in the stripes with 6.5-10 range. Most adjustment will be needed for ATP, least - for UTP.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bring pH of each NTP to 6.8-7.2 by adding 5 µl of 5N NaOH followed by 10-90 µl of 1N NaOH. Monitor pH in the stripes with 6.5-10 range. Most adjustment will be needed for ATP, least - for UTP.

components.data:
Measure absorbance of 500 fold dilution: 3 µl to 1.5 ml of H2O.

 

ATP λmax 259 nm, εmax 1.59 × 104 cm-1 M-1

CTP λmax 271 nm, εmax 0.9 × 104 cm-1 M-1

GTP λmax 253 nm, εmax 1.37 × 104 cm-1 M-1

UTP λmax 259 nm, εmax 1.59 × 104 cm-1 M-1

components.data:
Mix the following in a 100 μl reaction: 

 

 

Final concentrations:

20 μl 5X transcription buffer

 (1X)

5 μl 100 mM ATP

 (5 mM)

5 μl 100 mM CTP

 (5 mM)

5 μl 100 mM GTP

 (5 mM)

5 μl 100 mM UTP

 (5 mM)

1 μl 1M DTT

 (10 mM)

0.1 μl 1 mg/mL pyrophosphatase (Roche)

 (1 ug/ml)

10 μl 1 mg/mL T7 polymerase

 (100 ug/ml)

10 μl 10 uM hybridized template

 (1 uM)
DEPC H2O to 100 μl

source_data.annotation: My typical final yields on transcription reactions of this size are roughly 30 μl of 10-20 uM (300-600 pmol). For my biochemical purposes, this is more than enough material. However, the above reaction can easily be scaled up.
source_data.thread_text: My typical final yields on transcription reactions of this size are roughly 30 μl of 10-20 uM (300-600 pmol). For my biochemical purposes, this is more than enough material. However, the above reaction can easily be scaled up.

source_data.description: Incubate at 37 °C, overnight.

components.data:
DNase treat:

 

  1. Add 5 units (5 μl) RNase-free DNase directly to reaction.
  2. Incubate at 37 °C, 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.annotation: My RNAs run very close to the xylene cyanol dye. Therefore, I use a gel loading buffer that contains only bromophenol blue.
source_data.thread_text: My RNAs run very close to the xylene cyanol dye. Therefore, I use a gel loading buffer that contains only bromophenol blue.

components.data: Gel-purify transcribed RNAs on a medium thickness, denaturing urea-polyacrylamide gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gel-purify transcribed RNAs on a medium thickness, denaturing urea-polyacrylamide gel.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 13 of Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.protocol_name: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.annotation: For my RNAs (~30 nt) I use a 15% gel. At this polyacrylamide concentration, with RNA from a 100 μl transcription reaction, I get excellent separation of the desired RNA length from n+1 and n-1 contaminants (these arise from template-independent addition of nts by T7 polymerase; and synthetic template oligos that are not the full length). Optimization of the gel running time and acrylamide concentration will be necessary for gel-purifying RNAs of different length.
source_data.thread_text: For my RNAs (~30 nt) I use a 15% gel. At this polyacrylamide concentration, with RNA from a 100 μl transcription reaction, I get excellent separation of the desired RNA length from n+1 and n-1 contaminants (these arise from template-independent addition of nts by T7 polymerase; and synthetic template oligos that are not the full length). Optimization of the gel running time and acrylamide concentration will be necessary for gel-purifying RNAs of different length.
source_data.body: For my RNAs (~30 nt) I use a 15% gel. At this polyacrylamide concentration, with RNA from a 100 μl transcription reaction, I get excellent separation of the desired RNA length from n+1 and n-1 contaminants (these arise from template-independent addition of nts by T7 polymerase; and synthetic template oligos that are not the full length). Optimization of the gel running time and acrylamide concentration will be necessary for gel-purifying RNAs of different length.

components.data:
PAGE Fragment Resolution: Denaturing Conditions (6M Urea)

 

 

 

Clean glass plates with EtOH and coat with 200 μl Silanization Solution I.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
PAGE Fragment Resolution: Denaturing Conditions (6M Urea)

 

 

 

Clean glass plates with EtOH and coat with 200 μl Silanization Solution I.
Assemble glass plates.
Prepare 15% urea polyacrylamide gel.

components.data:
Denaturing Urea Polyacrylamide Gel (300 ml for a gig gel: 35 x 25 cm) 

 

  10% 12.5% 15%

10x TBE

30 ml

 30 ml 30 ml

40% Acrylamide-bisacrylamide (19:1)

 75 ml 93.75 ml 112.5 ml
Urea 108 g 108 g 108 g
Water 192 ml 173 ml 155 ml

Before casting add:

      
10% APS 1.5 ml 1.5 ml 1.5 ml
TEMED 600 µl 600 µl 600 µl

 

After addition of APS and TEMED to Urea-Polyacrylamide mixture pour the gel immediately.

components.data: Place comb and polymerize for 60 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place comb and polymerize for 60 min.
Assemble electrophoresis apparatus.
Remove comb.

components.data: Fill inner and outer buffer chambers with 1x TBE.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fill inner and outer buffer chambers with 1x TBE.
Rinse wells with 1x TBE buffer.

components.data:
Pre-run the gel for 30 min to heat-up and remove remaining urea. Set constant P=40 W,

3000 V, 400 mA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Pre-run the gel for 30 min to heat-up and remove remaining urea. Set constant P=40 W,

3000 V, 400 mA.
Load sample.

components.data: Run P=40 W, 3000 V, 400 mA for around 3 h, until the bromophenol blue band is migrating in the last 1⁄4 of the gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run P=40 W, 3000 V, 400 mA for around 3 h, until the bromophenol blue band is migrating in the last 1⁄4 of the gel.

components.data: Remove one of the glass plates and cover the gel with saran wrap. Flip. Remove another glass plate and cover all gel with saran wrap.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove one of the glass plates and cover the gel with saran wrap. Flip. Remove another glass plate and cover all gel with saran wrap.

components.data: UV shadow band and excise with sterile razor and place in Falcon tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: UV shadow band and excise with sterile razor and place in Falcon tube.
Break gel slices with p-1000 tip.

components.data: Crush and soak gel slices in equal volume of RNase-free water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Crush and soak gel slices in equal volume of RNase-free water.
Elute RNA overnight by rocking at 4 °C.

components.data: Filter out gel pieces by spinning sample through Corning Spin-X filter tube. Centrifuge at top speed for 5 minutes, 4 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter out gel pieces by spinning sample through Corning Spin-X filter tube. Centrifuge at top speed for 5 minutes, 4 °C.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 32 of Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase

source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.annotation: I cut the top off a P-1000 tip so that I can pipette as much as possible of the water-gel slurry into the Corning filter tube.
source_data.thread_text: I cut the top off a P-1000 tip so that I can pipette as much as possible of the water-gel slurry into the Corning filter tube.
source_data.body: I cut the top off a P-1000 tip so that I can pipette as much as possible of the water-gel slurry into the Corning filter tube.

components.data: Add 30 μl 10x NEBuffer 3 to each sample, then 1 μl CIP (10 U/μl). Incubate at 37 °C for one hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 30 μl 10x NEBuffer 3 to each sample, then 1 μl CIP (10 U/μl). Incubate at 37 °C for one hour.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Protocol for in vitro transcription of DNA oligos by T7 polymerase
source_data.annotation: This step is only required if removal of the 5’ triphosphate is required (e.g. if the RNA will subsequently be 5’-radiolabeled with T4 PNK.)
source_data.thread_text: This step is only required if removal of the 5’ triphosphate is required (e.g. if the RNA will subsequently be 5’-radiolabeled with T4 PNK.)
source_data.body: This step is only required if removal of the 5’ triphosphate is required (e.g. if the RNA will subsequently be 5’-radiolabeled with T4 PNK.)

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extract with 300-500 μl phenol-chloroform solution, pH 8.0.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Phenol/chloroform extract with 300-500 μl phenol-chloroform solution, pH 8.0.

components.data: Ethanol precipitate the RNA, by adding 1/10 volume 3 M NaOAc (pH 5.2), 1/100 volume 100x linearized acrylamide and 3 volumes 100% ethanol. [described in step 35-40 below]
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Ethanol precipitate the RNA, by adding 1/10 volume 3 M NaOAc (pH 5.2), 1/100 volume 100x linearized acrylamide and 3 volumes 100% ethanol. [described in step 35-40 below]

components.data: Incubate at -80 °C, at least 1 hour
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at -80 °C, at least 1 hour

components.data: Spin down at top speed, 20 minutes, 4 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down at top speed, 20 minutes, 4 °C.
Remove supernatant.
Wash pellet with 70% ethanol.
Spin down again and remove supernatant.
Dry pellets in speed vacuum, ~10 minutes.

components.data: Resuspend pellets in 30 μl DEPC H2O (or buffer) and store at –20 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend pellets in 30 μl DEPC H2O (or buffer) and store at –20 °C.
